dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: ...I mean, it's just, uh, ridiculous! How can they say spring has arrived and then, like, this?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: ...I mean, it's just, uh, ridiculous! How can they say spring has arrived and then, like, this?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, wait, ridiculous? What are you even talking about?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, wait, ridiculous? What are you even talking about?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: The forecast, B! Kazhydromet. They're predicting snowstorms in the north, rain and sleet in the south. For March 8th!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The forecast, B! Kazhydromet. They're predicting snowstorms in the north, rain and sleet in the south. For March eighth!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Although spring has arrived, northwestern cyclones continue to affect the entire country, bringing snowstorms in the north, rain and sleet in the south, and strong winds across the republic.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but that's just the start. You're completely missing the point.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but that's just the start. You're completely missing the point.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: The point is it's not spring! "Spring has arrived," they say, uh, and then tell us to brace for freezing temperatures.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The point is it's not spring! Spring has arrived, they say, uh, and then tell us to brace for freezing temperatures.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Although spring has arrived... By March 10, nighttime temperatures in northern regions are expected to reach -12 to -20 degrees Celsius," the statement said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, the real point is the anticyclone. Did you even read that far?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, the real point is the anticyclone. Did you even read that far?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I did! It says temperatures will drop to minus twenty in the north by the 10th! That's not spring, that's, like, mid-winter again!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I did! It says temperatures will drop to minus twenty in the north by the tenth! That's not spring, that's, like, mid-winter again!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: By March 10, nighttime temperatures in northern regions are expected to reach -12 to -20 degrees Celsius," the statement said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But the precipitation stops! No more snow, no more sleet. That's a win, A. That's progress.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But the precipitation stops! No more snow, no more sleet. That's a win, A. That's progress.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, starting March 9, an anticyclone will begin shifting from the west, leading to a cessation of precipitation and a drop in temperatures.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Progress? We're going from snowstorms to, uh, arctic blasts! How is that progress?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Progress? We're going from snowstorms to, uh, arctic blasts! How is that progress?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Because it clears up! The wind will still be strong, sure, but itâ€™s dry cold. It's a different kind of cold.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Because it clears up! The wind will still be strong, sure, but it's dry cold. It's a different kind of cold.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...northwestern cyclones continue to affect the entire country, bringing... strong winds across the republic.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A different kind of miserable, you mean. I, uh, I just can't believe they call this spring.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A different kind of miserable, you mean. I, uh, I just can't believe they call this spring.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: They're stating a fact, the calendar says it's spring. The weather's transitioning.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They're stating a fact, the calendar says it's spring. The weather's transitioning.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Transitioning backward, it seems! To -20 degrees by March 10th. For spring.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Transitioning backward, it seems! To -twenty degrees by March tenth. For spring.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: By March 10, nighttime temperatures in northern regions are expected to reach -12 to -20 degrees Celsius," the statement said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Look, it's Kazakhstan. What do you expect? It's not, um, exactly the Riviera.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Look, it's Kazakhstan. What do you expect? It's not, um, exactly the Riviera.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I expect them to not, you know, try to sugarcoat it with "spring has arrived" when it's clearly not.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I expect them to not, you know, try to sugarcoat it with spring has arrived when it's clearly not.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Although spring has arrived, northwestern cyclones continue to affect the entire country...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It is spring. The effects of winter are just lingering. It's an important distinction, A.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It is spring. The effects of winter are just lingering. It's an important distinction, A.
